titles.title: To require that an application for a writ of habeas corpus be submitted with the consent of the person for whose relief it is intended.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

bill.summary: 5/11/1994--Introduced. Amends the Federal judicial code to provide that, in any appeal of a person convicted of a felony for which such person previously has been determined to be capable of aiding in his or her own defense, no other person may present an application for a writ of habeas corpus without the convicted person's consent or without showing that such convicted person is mentally incompetent.
